page.title: 16RECREATION
page.content:
There is a Quoits team in Thornton Watlass and one in Thirn.The game is played behind the Buck Inn in Watlass and the Boot and Shoe in Thirn.Each village has two teams,team A and team B, which play in the Lower Dales League.
To keep the pitch moist they put oil in with the clay which is bought from Littlethorpe Pottery.Each player has two malleable steel quoits which are thrown over a cast iron pin in the clay.This is called a ringer.If your opponent is the last to throw on the peg he gets the point.
Shooting is a popular sport in the area. Local Gun Clubs arrange regular shoots about the farms. Pheasant, hare and rabbit are among the game taken, according to season.
